about.title: Meet Dr. Kristhy
about.subtitle: Evidence-based care with empathy and active listening.
bio: I’m Dr. Kristhy Karina Moreno Molina, Specialist in Obstetrics & Gynecology. Since 2013 I’ve cared for women with warmth and clinical rigor. I trained and specialized at Universidad de los Andes (ULA), combining solid academics with a close, human approach.

My work at Hospital Central de San Cristóbal prepared me for obstetric emergencies, gynecologic surgery, and high-risk pregnancies, always prioritizing maternal-fetal safety. Experience in clinics, rural care, and hospital shifts helps me understand every need.

I stay in continuous training: Public and Occupational Health diplomas, maternal-fetal Doppler ultrasound, and updated surgical techniques. Each visit is a safe space with clear communication, active listening, and personalized plans.
about.education: Physician and Specialist in Obstetrics & Gynecology (ULA). Diplomas in Public and Occupational Health. Ongoing training in maternal-fetal Doppler.

philosophy.title: My Care Philosophy
content: The doctor-patient relationship comes first: I listen, accompany, and respect your decisions to deliver humanized care.
I guide every reproductive stage with clear communication so you understand each step and feel supported and safe.
I use evidence-based protocols and multidisciplinary teams when needed, blending clinical precision with genuine warmth.
